items.text: full on leg stump, paddles it but can't beat short fine to his right
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.text: length on middle stump, backs away and punches to the bowler
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.preText: Shakib into the attack, round the wicket
items.text: tossed up on leg stumps, and turned away to square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, 1 run

items.text: gives himself room and cuts this ball from outside off to sweeper
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Mohammad Shahzad, 1 run

items.text: full ball on the stumps, leading edge to cover
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: spotted him coming down and fired it in wider, but the batsman got back into the crease quickly
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: tossed up on the stumps, driven back where Shakib goes to his left to field it
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: tossed up on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.preText: Rakesh Sampat: "It's a blessing that the ACB is not as Cash Rich as the BCCI and does not have time for silly tests like the YOYO test, else we might have lost players like Shahzad who show their skill with the bat which is what the game is all about rather than some strange "Fitness" Tests. Come to think of it, if YOYO was made the benchmark in 70's, the world would never have seen the likes of Llyod, Richards, Gavaskar, Vishwanath, Gower, Lara, Ranatunga, Arvinda de silva who just created magic with their bat"
items.text: flattish on the stumps, he gives himself some room and glides it to third man
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Mohammad Shahzad, 1 run

items.text: tossed up on the stumps, and driven back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: fired in a bit that time on the stumps, and he keeps playing it straight back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: length ball outside off, he cuts it but point fields to his left
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: tossed up on the stumps again, and he tries to drive it past the bowler, but he goes to his right to dive and collect the ball
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: comes down the track and tucks it away towards midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hashmatullah Shahidi, 1 run

items.preText: Nitin: "The yo-yo test may need more analysis but it's good have a minimum level of fitness to perform well. Shahzad may seem healthy but he seems fit too :)"
items.text: flat on the stumps, swatted back to the bowler
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: goes inside out comes down the track and goes over the infield. the ball races to long-on where the substitute fielder dives and pulls it back in. They check the replay but he's fine
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, 2 runs

items.text: comes down and clips it to mid-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, 1 run

items.text: length ball on off, turning a bit away, Shahzad punches it in the direction of the turn to cover
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Mohammad Shahzad, 1 run

items.text: steps out again but can only clip it to short midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, no run

items.text: shorter and flatter, hit with horizontal bat to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hashmatullah Shahidi, 1 run

items.preText:
Mahmudullah with the ball now

Neel: "@Rakesh: The yo-yo test and focus on fitness has really boosted the Indian team's fielding, pace bowling and running between the wickets. I think it's a great model. Besides, what's stopping Shahzad from getting fit and passing the yo-yo test? "
items.text: fired in flat from around the wicket, and it's turned to midwicket. Would have been a two, but it's Shahzad, so they decide it's too risky
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Hashmatullah Shahidi, 1 run

items.text: gave himself room and went back, the ball was on middle and leg but he cut it from there. Point goes to his left to make a tumbling stop
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.text: goes back in his crease again, but can't get this length ball away
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.text: he did it with the bat, now with the ball Shahzad had been backing away to give himself room, and Mahmudullah was wise to it. Slightly quicker and the arm ball on leg stump - the batsman misses, the bowler hits
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Mohammad Shahzad, OUT

items.preText:
Here's Asghar. 

Nivas: "Yoyo test makes a skilled player better. As 90s kids didn't we dream an Indian team on par with Australian team of 2003 world cup? Yoyo is one of the attempts to reach that level. No. Of good pace bowlers in India after yoyo is a proof of its effect."
items.text: tossed up on the stumps and driven, but wide mid-on moves to his left for a tumbling stop
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Asghar Afghan, no run
